title: Structs [2]
description: Using our struct from last lesson, make a function make_point(int x, int y) that returns a point struct.
expectedOutput:
PASS: maxOf(3, 7) == 7
PASS: maxOf(2.5f, 1.5f) == 2.5
PASS: maxOf(4.0, 4.5) == 4.5
hint:
You can make an item of a struct by doing either structname varname; and then varname.structfeilname = value; for each field, or structname varname = {varfields in order}. You can return any type fro ma struct by making the return type that name.
An advanced thing(try making the varibale then returning it first) is C++ is smart, so if you define the return type, you can just write return {structfieldsdef}; and it will work. As you probably have noticed, you cannot return multiple values from a function in c++, however, you can return an enum and use that as multiple values.
